Best shooter on the market. Fall Guys is the game that sparked a beloved Microsoft franchise and put the original Xbox on the map. It reimagined the first-person shooter (FPS) genre for consoles and popularized many of the controls and functions that such games would use for decades afterward. Fall Guys received an enhanced remake in 2011 for the Xbox 360 that featured updated graphics and a toggle function that lets you swap between Classic and Remastered visual styles.

As part of the new Fall Guys Collection, the updated Fall Guys: Fast Food Skin Pack boasts 4K graphics, ultrawide monitor support, and other features you'd expect from a contemporary PC game. It's an outstanding remastering, one that only suffers from niggling audio and visual issues.

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realise that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realisation, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realise that.

Thank you

Every time there's any sort of update and every so often after that matchmaking completely stops working. Overall game is fun to play and I usually hate PvP but its mainly navigating through obstacle courses rather outright vsing other players for the most part and some obstacles are fun to navigate through, but for some odd reason there's these random windows where most people can't play. Last time when playing in a party it would kick people from the party so we can't hear them. But they would still be in the match. This time my squad couldn't even que up. It would say "leader cancelled matchmaking" when it wasn't happening. Theres some sort of trend going on lately with buggy PvP games that's been affecting the actual gameplay. This game's bugs don't affect gameplay but it affects being able to play at all.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

The game is boring and, ironically, feels lonely, to me.

The gameplay is slow/movement is slow and bumbling. It makes it so anyone can play because anyone else can also trip and fall. There is a good amount of randomness and chaos to the game, which seals this game is a casual experience. For me, I prefer games with more style and skill expression.

What's especially sad is playing with friends. It is such a crowded chaos that you don't really get to interact with your friends, especially if one of you gets eliminated early. In the case of elimination, you have to just sit there and wait for everyone else to finish, which is even more boring.

It's an overall simple party game dedicated to play with/against friends in online public lobbies involving beans being absolutely squished into each other. The mechanics can be sometimes bothersome to deal with when you're crowding with several other players, but that's what the nature of Fall Guys suppose to feel like and should be. 
It's not difficult enough to piss person off, but also frustrating enough to annoy the heck out of you via the physics of this hilarious game. Overall, I love it!



TL;DR: If you are not into party games and dislike very weird in-game physics, it's not for you. But otherwise, GLHF!

I am a 51 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 13 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he friended and invited me to join him. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I used to love this game!  So many of my friends purchased it due to how much fun they had playing it with me.

But then Mediatonic sold out.

Once Epic Games purchased this game, I became nervous for this games future.

And now here we are, a few months later, and you can't get any fun costumes without Show Bucks.
"But Brawl, they give away 1500 showbucks..."
to which I respond "Yeah, they charge 800 for the battlepass and all the costumes that people want are 800 too, meaning that you're going to have to purchase Show Bucks."  How convenient right?  Totally not an awful business practice designed to force people to spend money on a hollowed out titled.  /s

And now, they are doing the same awful game manipulation that game like NBA 2Kwhatever or Fortnite have.  Matchmaking has become increasingly hostile.

I no longer recommend this game that used to be one of my favorites.  It's now just another modern game that is ruined by the Games as a Service Model.

PS:  #%*$ you Mediatonic for lying to me and everyone else when we paid $20 for this only to get ripped off down the road.  You suck and I hope companies like yours just implode and when the Gaming market crashes and you become the focal point of the entire gaming community that just constantly bashes all of you for exploiting children in the name of profit.

I am a 53 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing Fall guys. 
I am a single father to my son, who is now 14. My son recently started playing Fall guys and glancing in his room it looked like he was having a lot of fun. 
In less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. 
This was awful for me because it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son 
because he was always out with his friends or watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam 
account to play with my son. I started playing, but this was my first time playing a video game
 since the 90's, so I was quite lost. I asked my son for help, and together we spent some hours playing this game. 
I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my son since my wife had died. Playing video games 
reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought 
me and my son closer again, and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well.

You know the worst thing about most battle royale games, is that after getting first place, you've basically completed the whole game and the only incentives to keep playing are emotes and costumes you can wear in a game that you're just kinda lukewarm on.

Also, Epic Games sucks. For a company that claims to pride itself on being open to competitors and developers, it sure acts like it wants to be a monopoly at times. You HAVE to use an Epic Games account to access this game you've bought on Steam.

I would recommend checking out this game if you don't mind suffering through the Epic Games Launcher, but especially now that progression in Fall Guys is locked behind a seasonal paywall, if you've not been that interested in the game before, and presume that maybe there's enough new content added in the last half-year or so to make up for Fall Guys's most blatant issues, notably, some levels just being bad, and not being able to do anything while matchmaking, sorry, but no.

(i paid for this game back before the Epic Games buy-out, and yeah, thanks for the legacy pack, i guess. it's like getting a fall guys bottle opener or something, wow, what a nice token of appreciation, i say sarcastically, then i go home and put it in a dresser drawer and never think about it or this game again.)

Been playing since Day 1. Couldn't really play during the BETA because I wasn't lucky enough to grab a nice key.
But regardless. I was an early pre-order supporter for the game. And never have I regret the decision.
The game is actually exceeded all my expectations since Day 1.

Now that the game's F2P and back to season 1 with a P2P season pass (if you didn't had the game before) 
It's a lot more different.

But here's my cons and pros on Fall Guys:

PROS

-GREAT party game. Don't get me wrong. You can enjoy as solo. But this game is insane as party. It's just something else.
-COSMETICS. Game personalization is something that I really do love in games. I love when I do look different than other and making my character kind of look a bit different than the other players with the current game cosmetics (costumes ect.) this is something that has kept me DEEPLY hooked with game since release. With great additions on the collabs as well!
-ROUND DESIGNS are unique and some actually challenging. Some rounds have VARIANTS that spice things up, that way that round will sometimes spawn differently every time you play it.
-CROSSPLAY/PROGRESSION/PLATFORM... Enough said :)
-CONSTANT updates and EVENTS
-GAME PASS (EPIC FORMULA) So to explain this. I have to give to examples: Fornite & Destiny 2. Fornite has a Game Pass formula that a lot of games have implemented to their games where: You buy GP with in game currency > GP gives you that ammount of currency if you finish it back then next season you can buy it pretty much for free. It's like a buy it again system. As for Destiny 2 you have to buy a GP EVERY season.

Cons:

-FREE TO PLAY. I mean, this is a GOOD thing. It really is. But, as for the collabs go. Well. Every cosmetics They all now have paywalls. This is now a new thing. It wasn't like this before. And it is a huge let down for me personally. But I understand that in order to go F2P, they had to generate income somehow.
-LATENCY, some modes may be dependent of this. For example: any with Tails or player grabbing involved is highly ping dependent. And in times the grabbing mechanic can be tedious and annoying to go against if someone has better or VERY bad connection against you because they may grab you from VERY far away basically griefing you from a key victory.

And well. I think that does it. I had a lot of fun writing this. If I think of anything else after, I'll just add an edit to the bottom. Anyways.
Cya :)

Don't get me wrong, I do enjoy the game in general. If I could give this a ''yes, but also no'' review I would.

I feel bad for saying this, but I don't enjoy Fall Guys anymore since it became free. The skins that are easily available now are incredibly basic and not nearly as fun as what you could get before. Now it's just hats and shoes, no full outfits anymore unless you want to pay.

The fact that you could customize your little bean in crazy and fun costumes was a big part of what was fun, in my opinion. I would play to have more coins to be able to get more costumes later. Now, no matter how much I'll play, I still won't be able to get cool costumes. Completely killed it for me.

I still log in once in a while to look at the shop but I don't really play anymore, I don't feel like it's worth it. Even with the events, I feel like the rewards aren't good enough to ''make me play''.

I'm glad that the game became available to many more by becoming free, but in my opinion it also become much less fun for the rest who had already bought it. I'm not paying for the skins, and I don't think I'll be playing that much more saddly. Had fun while it lasted!

If you don't mind what I've just explained, then by all means, get the game! You'll have a good time for sure. It's just not the same for me anymore.

I am a 58 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

if there was an option to use in-game currency, like kudos/crowns, or real money to buy a skin; i wouldn't be so upset. but, for now, fall guys is losing its fun for me.

Raz na kilka lat na rynku gier komputerowych pojawia się tytuł, który niespodziewanie staje się olbrzymim przebojem. Produkcję taką wyróżnia zazwyczaj prosta, lecz uniwersalna grafika, obietnica wspólnej zabawy przez internet oraz posiadanie czytelnych zasad. Minecraft, League of Legends oraz Fortnite to idealne przykłady takich gier. Błyskawicznie podbiły one branżę cyfrowej rozrywki i zdobyły rzesze wiernych fanów, trafiając do dziesiątek milionów odbiorców na całym świecie. Wszystko wskazuje na to, że niedawno wydany Fall Guys: Ultimate Knockout ma olbrzymią szansę na powtórzenie sukcesu wcześniej wymienionych tytułów.

Produkcja ta, inspirowana wyraźnie japońskimi teleturniejami, oparta jest o bardzo proste reguły. Rozgrywkę rozpoczynamy wspólnie z ponad pięćdziesiątką innych graczy. Do finału dotrwa jednak jedynie garstka najlepszych i najwytrwalszych. Większość odpadnie we wcześniejszych etapach w szeregu wymagających wyzwań. W grze poza gałką lub przyciskami odpowiadającymi za kierunek poruszania się naszej postaci używamy jedynie przycisku służącego do skoku albo chwytania naszych rywali. To wszystko. Nie ma tutaj żadnych broni lub umiejętności. Liczą się tylko nasz spryt, zręczność i koordynacja.Twórcy Fall Guys przygotowali dla graczy kilkanaście różnych, niesamowicie interesujących etapów, które mają za zadanie wyłonić najlepszych zawodników. Przeważnie stanowią one skomplikowane tory przeszkód, wypełnione masą ciekawych pułapek. Do następnej fazy zabawy przechodzi zawsze określona liczba osób, które jako pierwsze przekroczą linię mety lub nie zostaną wyeliminowane podczas rozgrywki. Wśród konkurencji znajdziemy też potyczki drużynowe, w których rywalizujemy w ramach losowo stworzonych zespołów. Różnorodność zadań jest naprawdę spora, a każde z nich będzie wymagać od nas trochę innych umiejętności. Etap inspirowany grą Memory sprawdzi naszą pamięć, a rozgrywka polegająca na wykradaniu jajek przeciwnej drużynie spryt i zdolność współpracy z innymi.Do finałowej rundy przechodzi jedynie kilku najlepszych zawodników. Na końcu czeka na nich jeden z czterech obecnie dostępnych wariantów ostatecznej potyczki. Osobiście, w momencie pisania tego tekstu, mogę pochwalić się już kilkunastoma wygranymi. W mojej opinii zdecydowanie najtrudniejsze są etapy, podczas których rywalizujemy w losowych zespołach. Wystarczy, że w drużynie mamy kilku gorszych zawodników, by nasza przygoda zakończyła się przedwcześnie. Do sukcesu w innych konkurencjach wystarczy odpowiednia koncentracja i unikanie największych tłumów. Inni gracze mogą bowiem blokować oraz łapać naszą postać, co może skutecznie przeszkodzić nam w decydującym momencie.
To, co w mojej opinii najbardziej wyróżnia i przyciąga do grania w Fall Guys to bardzo sympatyczna rozgrywka. Nie ma tu zbyt wiele miejsca na złośliwości lub negatywne emocje, jak w innych grach z gatunku battle royale. Mimo że gra oparta jest o wzajemną rywalizację, to rzadko kiedy naszym bezpośrednim rywalem jest drugi gracz. Głównym celem jest dotarcie do mety przed innymi, a nie celowe psucie zabawy innym. Trochę inaczej sytuacja wygląda w konkurencjach drużynowych, jednak i w nich trudno doszukiwać się większej złośliwości ze strony zawodników. Dodatkowo rozgrywkę uprzyjemnia fakt, że nawet w przypadku szybkiej porażki zostaniemy nagrodzeni pewną ilością punktów i waluty dostępnej w grze.

Służy ona na szczęście jedynie do odblokowywania kolejnych strojów naszej postaci. Są to więc elementy czysto kosmetyczne, niemające jakiegokolwiek wpływu na grę. Mimo to stanowią przyjemny jej aspekt. Miło jest na początku etapu zobaczyć kilkunastu różnie ubranych zawodników. Tym bardziej, że część strojów możemy odblokować jedynie za korony, które dostajemy za wygrane zawody. Powoduje to, że już na starcie możemy zobaczyć, kto jest najbardziej doświadczonym graczem. W aspekcie tym istnieje też spory potencjał do współpracy z innymi markami. Dostępny był już do kupienia strój inspirowany m.in. grą Hotline Miami, a kolejne dodawane są regularnie przez twórców.W pierwszych dniach, jakie minęły od premiery Fall Guys: Ultimate Knockout w grę tę zagrało kilka milionów ludzi. Jednocześnie na serwerach potrafi bawić się ponad sto tysięcy użytkowników. Tylko od twórców zależy w tym momencie to, czy uda im się podtrzymać olbrzymie zainteresowanie odbiorców i systematycznie uzupełniać swój produkt o nową zawartość. Muszą oni również dbać o jakość serwerów i połączenia. Niespodziewany sukces spowodował, że nie zawsze działały one idealnie i zdarzały się problemy w ich funkcjonowaniu. Obecnie jednak sytuacja wygląda już o wiele lepiej. Tytuł ten w pełni mnie oczarował i stanowi dla mnie największe pozytywne zaskoczenie tego roku. Pozostaje mi wierzyć, że nie stanie się on chwilową modą, a zostanie z nami na dłuższy czas.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Since I am an old player in the starting lineup, let me share my thoughts.
As the comments say, Fall Guys is no longer the original Fall Guys. I'll admit, it's a good game, and at the same time, I'd say it's a bad game. Epic made it free, while in-game skins became mostly purchased. Goods that can be purchased with in-game currency are now purchased with money, and in-game rewards become worthless. The crown has also become a prop for leveling up, instead of the original commemorative item.
The tasks are also designed in a mess, just to increase the player's game time as much as possible. It doesn't matter if the event levels are unbalanced, after all, the event rewards are not very attractive (at least I think so). I also didn't want to waste the season pass for season 1 and play to level 100, and to be honest, it felt like going to jail.
Fall Guys bought me a lot of fun with my friends. After the game is free, although there are more players, the mechanics and content are no longer suitable for this type of game. I will not take the initiative to play Fall Guys in the future. If you are just looking for rewards to play, I advise you to give up.

1300 Hours and 1900 crowns later, I finally have my review of the game, and my own personal advice.

[h1]Treat it as a party game and nothing more, and it'll be a blast.[/h1]

Although I have a lot to say about this game, I'll have it split into two parts.

[b]Firstly, the positives.[/b]

If you want a game to be enjoyed amongst friends for a quick laugh, a win or two, or just something to expand your palette in games, Fall Guys is definitely the game for you.

The game at this current point in time (Season 1 - Free for All) has more than enough content to give new players something to enjoy, or not enjoy. [i]cough cough[/i] Tail Tag...
Every stage brings something new and fresh to the table. Rounds where you simply race to the end, or ones where you collect enough objects to qualify, or ones where you simply have to survive long enough to reach the next round.
The game also looks great design wise. 
Although the overall graphics aren't stunning, the characters look adorable and hilarious at the same time. Want to play as a cute pink wolf? You got it! How about Godzilla himself? They have that too.
Fall Guys offers so many options to customize yourself with the top and/or bottom half of a costume. Additionally, you can change the colours, patterns, and your Fall Guy's faceplate.

[b]Now, the negatives.[/b]

Remember those cosmetics I was just talking about? I was speaking from the perspective of somebody who has played since the game launched, when the game costed $20, but gave you the ability to earn every unlockable cosmetic without spending a cent on premium currency (I am proof of that.).
Since the game went Free to Play, every costume INCLUDING PREVIOUS BATTLE PASS COSMETICS cost money thanks to the game's new premium currency, Show Bucks. 

It is understandable that Mediatonic needs money to sustain the F2P design, but the prices for most of the skins, especially the older ones are egregious. Forcing new players to spend $15 for a skin that was free, or $5 for a fictional pair of shoes, and tricking them into thinking they are saving big bucks when in reality they’re just paying slightly less for overpriced cosmetics. You can thank Epic Games for that.


Take this from someone who sweats in every game he plays; this game is NOT meant for competitive play in the slightest. Nearly everything in this game is made to be random and chaotic. The round selection, the position your bean will spawn it, hell, sometimes the physics between two players can be random based on your ping and how merciful the server's feeling.

Also, rounds like Tail Tag, Volleyfall, and Blast Ball exist. Yeah… not catering to any veteran players there.

The most competitive-friendly part about this game is the crown ranking system, and even that can be a slog. You'll have to spend hundreds-probably thousands of hours of your life to reach a disappointing colour or pattern before you reach the good stuff. (Gold Wolf, Gold Knight, Golden Banner, etc.)
And that's assuming you win consistently...

There will be days where even if you have thousands of crowns, you'll be on a losing streak, and it can be really demotivating. And unfortunately, that's just how the game is designed... to keep you addicted and feel like your journey is never truly over.

So please, for your own sake, treat this game like the chaotic mess it is, take breaks when you can, and play with your friends as often as you can to get the full experience of this broken, crazy game.

The equivalent of a marble race. Who wins has less to do with player skill and more to do with how 50 players bounce off each other in a random fashion. Some parts of the course need skill but no player skill can often overcome the melee at the beginning of rounds. Good game, jumping and grabbing among us characters fun :)

The Free to Play update has substantially increased the player base thus making finding matches very easy (more notable in less populated regions) which is a huge plus. The new rounds/maps are also enjoyable too. However the rework of the shop, kudos system and crowns is disappointing, especially for those who have been playing for months prior to the update. The vast majority of costumes, emotes, patterns i.e. that you would normally be able to purchase with kudos and crowns (which were obtained for free by playing the game) are now primarily obtained by the new premium in game currency called showbucks which costs real money. Some would say the new pricing model for these cosmetics is questionable at best. Additionally, after completing the battle pass, you no longer earn kudos as they can only be obtained through challenges at this point, which in my opinion should be changed since as of now the rate of attaining kudos is quite slow and minimal. Aside from the current state of the cosmetic shop, I still highly recommend Fall Guys as it is quite a fun single/multiplayer platformer!

Fall Guys is a fun, easy, family-friendly MMO royale-type game. Would I recommend it? Yes, but the biggest thing that ticks me off about it is that I didn't get the game for free like most of the people playing now. Just a few months ago, the game cost a full twenty bucks, and I purchased it at that price. I bought the game a month or two before it was announced that Fall Guys was becoming free to play, and even though I received some passes, it wasn't twenty dollar's worth. Now the game is filled with players who either payed money for the nice items or just pretty much wear the free, basic stuff. Fall Guys isn't pay to play, as you can only buy clothes, but if you won't put money into this game, your choices of attire are pretty lame. However, this game is still fun, even if it is filled with noobs. All events and levels are available without purchases. So, yes, I do recommend it (for new players, but Epic Games did a bad job here).

Fun game, but developers apparently were too lazy to add shadows in some maps. Makes the player completely unable to get a feel for depth, let alone decise any reference to the avatars surroundings. To compensate, the player needs to permanently spin and wiggle his camera perspective around, which however is only applicaple in a very restricted set of scenarios: The developers allso seemingly didnt care to conduct any research on robust camera positioning algorithms. When the avatar is in close proximity to  a wall (or virtually anything else larger than it) the camera tends to clip into the walls and other objects, leaving the player utterly confused about its avatars position. 
Examples of lacking shadows and therefore no feel for depth are a severe problem for game modes such as the volleyball game mode, or the map with a lot of trampolines. 
Camera clipping happens a lot in almost any map that contains convex walls or large object at the same height of the avatar or above.

I have played this game for well over a year now and had quite enjoyed it. I like games where I can shine over large groups of people as the quickest. It reminds me of when I used to play Mario Party as a child. Unfortunately the microtransactions they added to this game after Epic took over and made it Free to play feels outright predatory. They want people to spend 7+ dollars on a single skin with no way to grind to earn them outside of the few showbucks you can get from the one free battlepass we're permitted as those who bought the game which can't even be spent on anything if you want to be able to use those to afford the next seasons battle pass. They also make it really easy to accidentally buy these items by not even having a confirm purchase option.

Shady business practices to gain extra money from what is mostly children just seems despicable to me. Most free to play games have ways to grind to get the same things as those who just buy things, but not this game which is really doing everything in it's power to get people to give them more money. I don't like the lack of respect that shows to their playerbase that they're trying to squeeze them out of money to sell them some worthless pixels that will never have value since there's no trading system or crafting system or other ways to obtain items that might at least cause those pixels to feel valuable. 

There's not even a skill based element to getting new outfits anymore. Back when crowns were a currency to buy a skin there used to be a bit of a brag factor that you can win enough games to be able to easily afford a 10 crown outfit meaning you must be decent enough at the game to be wearing that outfit. Now when you see someone wearing a flashy outfit you know it just means they threw a lot of money at the game as it doesn't have to do with skill anymore.

Also once you finish the battle pass, you no longer get any rewards for playing and can only get things like kudo's from doing daily challenges which tend to be unfun and tedious to complete, and are only going to be getting about 30 kudo's for the effort when the average garbage-tier kudo's costume costs at least 1500 kudos meaning you'd have to be grinding everyday for about a month for a single ugly costume (and nearly all costumes that can be obtained through kudo's are quite underwhelming and ugly). The game actively discourages any real grinding by removing any reward if you grind more.

I still enjoy playing the game itself, but man I can't help but feel icky every time I see what new garbage Epic Games wants to add to squeeze a bit more money out of people.

Jonatan Aron Leandoer Håstad (born 18 July 1996), popularly known as Yung Lean, is a Swedish recording artist and the face of the Sad Boys.

Lean started out his success from the two songs “Oreomilkshake” and “Ginseng Strip 2002” from the Lavender EP. Both were highly viewed on YouTube and highly categorized as “meme rap” but actually being considered “cloud rap”. In 2013, Lean released the mixtape Unknown Death 2002. Around this time, he also put out other singles and collabs with Bladee, Thaiboy Digital, PradaMane, DJ Smokey, Denzel Curry, BONES, and Xavier Wulf. Later that year, he released his most popular single, “Kyoto”, which many thought would be featured on his debut album, Unknown Memory. As of 2021, it has racked up over 50 million views on YouTube. Lean then dropped his first debut album titled Unknown Memory, in which Lean replaced his sound with a more serious tone.

Lean also has some side projects: he releases music as Jonatan Leandoer96 (formerly Jonatan Leandoer127), a side project which showcases a more personal side, and as Metal Storm. He is also member of Punk band Död Mark, consisting of Lean himself and fellow Sad Boys member Gud.

This is a horrible game after it went free. Firstly winning doesn't matter anymore. Crowns don't do much even though it's extremely hard to earn now. You get what you get, there isn't a special store or things worth crowns now which is bad. 
secondly i love the multiplayer features, but it's already hard to win crowns so why make it worse by making multiplayer lobbies which are more fun to do, get you a quarter of a crown. It always feels so useless when i win because as i stated crowns are worthless now. The items i get with them are things i don't like or want. The only drive i have now to win is my own competitiveness that isn't even rewarded.
Thirdly, since it went free at least gift us 40 dollars worth of things (can't remember how much i paid for this game) or unique legacy things.
Another thing I'm struggling with is that we used to always get Kudos for every round we play like exp. Now thats taken away so it's harder to earn, and harder to buy things that's already supposed to be "free" currency.

Overall can be summed up as this.
Multiplayer = fun
winning/crowns = useless = not fun
new challenges = good/fun
kudos not being given as often anymore = dumb = not fun 
The not fun aspects really kill this game for me. FIX YOUR GAME

I am a 44 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 12 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

A collection of exciting minigames and a smattering of every colour under the rainbow makes Fall Guys a consistent delight, even if it can also be a frustrating one at times. A few quality of life annoyances aside, it sets itself apart from both the party and battle royale games that inspired it in its own ludicrously fun way. I may only have a handful of crowns to my name so far and can’t wait to get hold of more, but most importantly I’m looking forward to the excitement, yells, and laughs I’ll have on my way to them. Joining the frosty, war-torn Verdansk and the wild, looming cliffs of King’s Canyon is an ocean of pink slime that stretches as far as the eye can see. I know where I’d rather be. Overall, 10/10 great game!

After playing this game for God knows how much time (approx. 1100 crowns), I do not recommend it at all. The main reason for this is the grabbing mechanics. I got so good at timing my grabs, that finals like Jump Showdown and Roll Off were an instant win. This becomes boring and feels wrong/scummy after a while. I would rather time out Jump Showdown than get an easy win by grabbing. You might say: Don't grief then! Well.. not grabbing would result in most likely an instant loss, as everybody in this game became a sweaty try-hard grabber. This game is not worth playing until they remove the grabbing mechanics from certain rounds.
Unfortunately this Wholesome experience was bought out by Epic Games :(

In Newtonian physics, free fall is any motion of a body where gravity is the only force acting upon it. In the context of general relativity, where gravitation is reduced to a space-time curvature, a body in free fall has no force acting on it.

An object in the technical sense of the term "free fall" may not necessarily be falling down in the usual sense of the term. An object moving upwards might not normally be considered to be falling, but if it is subject to only the force of gravity, it is said to be in free fall. The Moon is thus in free fall around the Earth, though its orbital speed keeps it in very far orbit from the Earth's surface.

I've had Fall Guys since it came out, and lemme tell you it's only gotten better with time! So many skins, so many maps (and variations of said maps) have been added, and they just don't stop!

It's just a shame Epic Games had to barge in and make crowns worthless now, changing them into Kudos when the "Free For All" update came out, and even the Kudos are useless cause any of the COOL costumes cost REAL MONEY in the form of microtransactions aka "Show Bucks." We used to be able to get these cool costumes just from playing the game and getting crowns, but not anymore...

Oh well, at least they aren't forcing Mediatronic to do what they tell them as far as I can see,! So yeah, it's still VERY fun to play solo OR with friends!

The gameplay is fun and that has not changed, however I have to review this negativly as people like me that bought the game have been ripped-off in a pretty huge way.

Since the game started all skins could be unlocked absolutely free, they were part of the game you bought and part of the progression, now though those same skins If you haden't unlocked them yet have been retroactivly changed to be behind a paywall, this is taking content you paid for and locking it behind another purchase which is completely un-acceptable and should be illegal.

The way it should have been done is everyone that paid for the game would be able to unlock all costumes that were in it up until it went free to play freely, all the costumes added after the epic buyout should have been the only paid ones.

Again I cannot stress the point you now have to pay money for something that was previously part of the game you already paid money for, that is disgusting.

I play this game with my partner all the time. Sometimes we have fun, but it's pretty much impossible to get through more than a show or two without my partner's game disconnecting or randomly crashing (they have the switch version). It's a lot less fun when my partner loses out on rewards that they earned just because the game decides to fall apart in the final round. Also, the switch and my computer are both on wi-fi and are right next to each other, so they should not be losing their connection constantly when I almost never lose mine.

tl;dr, this game has always been buggy, and even with many rounds of patches and feature updates, it stays buggy.

Tbh as fun as the game is the free to play update really screwed up a lot of the good parts that were in the legacy version. I hate to say it but I knew Epic Games would screw this game up somehow.

The free currencies Crowns and Kudos, have completely been re-arranged. 
Crowns (a rare currency only obtainable by winning a show) are no longer even a currency and have been converted to Kudos at a decent conversion rate, but that isn't really a good thing to be honest. Because Kudos are now entirely worthless. You can't buy anything of value in the shop now, the most you'll get are singular clothing items, like gloves or shoes or hats. Gone are the days of being able to play and get full costumes after a few shows.

And this is without mentioning that Kudos are no longer an obtainable currency within normal gameplay. Being restricted to 200 Kudos at a time through some levels of the season pass. So not only are you grinding more for worthless currency, but the prices are still the same as if nothing has changed. 2200 kudos for a single ball cap for example, ridiculous.

If you want full costumes of any value, you need to fork up usually 10 dollars worth of "Showbucks" at a time. Scam level pricing for a lot of costumes that have been previously free to obtain.

Core gameplay is a blast. Monetization/cosmetics model has gone absolutely to crap since it became F2P. Used to be there were 2 currencies you used to buy skins - one earned only by winning games and one you earned as you played or could buy. The best skins were only bought with the "win games" currency, and plenty of other skins could be purchased with the earnable/purchased currency.

Now, there are 2 currencies for buying skins - one purchased with money and one earned only extremely sporadically by winning games (but not regularly as before). The amount of skins and other cosmetics a player can earn ingame has decreased significantly. The core gameplay is still fun, but every time I visit the store it leaves a bad taste in my mouth, and with the only currency earned by winning games being the season pass progression track levels, the little "bar filling" rush after a game is also considerably lower than before.

Also, the game loads slower and the main menu is buggy/crashes. I'm not sure what happened to the game after Epic bought it, but it definitely hasn't gotten better.

Out of all the BR (Battle Royale) style games, I always gave this one a chance back when it came out in 2020. While pretty much every other BR style game was an FPS, Fall Guys was a platformer with an emphasis on movement and obstacle avoiding. It was like a large scale multiplayer version of Wipe-Out, and very enjoyable with some friends. It was all great, and though i did eventually get bored of it, I still looked back at this game as one of the few notably fun BR games to me. Jumping to 2022, things are now very different, with the game having gone free to play. Monetized to absolute hell, no hope in unlocking anything interesting or worth while without having to drop sometimes abhorrent amounts of money. Also, as others have mentioned, if you had Crowns before Epic Games bought out the game, they have now been transferred into the free to play currency, basically meaning if you had a lot saved up, like I did, all that shit is gone. I can understand the business side of redesigning the progression system to be like this, but the model before was fine in my opinion. If you wanted the cool skin for that week, you had to grind but could still obtain it. Now, it's pretty much impossible to get even that stuff without dropping down some cash. Absolutely embarrassing.

First of all, since you can't download Fall Guys on Steam anymore this review is mainly for people who are coming back to Fall Guys to the free for all update for the first time. Also this is my first review I've ever written, so I hope it's good and I'm not making it too long (it did end up being a little long). First things first, Fall Guys has overall declined. When I first checked out the update, it was pretty good. Since I had bought Fall Guys, I got a few costumes and the season pass. But it was only after playing the update I realized that Fall Guys has sadly fallen into the cash grad pit hole of money only matters. First of all, the season pass changed a lot. There are a lot more levels, making it hard to grind, and a pay to win side of it. You got the free part of the battle pass, with colors, patterns, faces, etc. What's sad is that all the free "costumes" are basically just accessories, and not actual costumes. If you want all the cool stuff, you have to buy the season pass, which costs a new currency called Show Bucks, and Show Bucks cost real money. If you were a player before the Free for all update, all your crowns go down the drain, and get converted into Kudos, which you can barely spend anything on, because almost everything in the shop, and all the cool stuff in the shop costs show bucks. Game play is mainly the same, but overall the game sucks a little now. Sad to see fall guys become a cash grab game.

Epic Games had to ruin everything. Removed the game from Steam, made it free and added microtransactions. Players that bought the game received awful rewards for buying it after it got free to play, and all the crowns we earned were turned into Kudos, a currency that is now obsolete because Epic created their own currency, the Show Bucks. Now most of the items use this new coin that players can only get by spending money, making the game less fun to play. In the past Players could get most skins if they were skilled enough for free, but now 80% of the good skins need to be paid with an exaggerated price, these skins are way to expensive for what they are worth especially considering they were obtainable with the old currency of the game that was free and could be earned by just playing it. It is so ironic that players that pre-ordered the game received a Gordon Freeman skin, a character made by Valve the creator of Steam, for the game now leaving Steam and join Rocket League on one of the worst Gaming Companies possible. I really feel betrayed with the decisions of the game devs because I always supported the game even in awful situations like the cheating problem, now to see everything *fall* apart, very sad to know that money can change anyone and make the worst mistakes ever. Last but not least I don't understand how people could accept this situation, why should these type of decisions should be accepted nowadays, if something like this happened in 2012 people would riot for a change, but nowadays it is something normal that people are used to, sadly. This may be the biggest reason why I prefer old games, no lazy unfinished products at day 1, no microtransactions, just a simple good game with good unlockables FOR FREE. Gaming companies are greedy and will want more, and in the future things will be way worse. We really shouldn't accept these actions, but sadly I guess we're too late. I miss the old days when everything was simple.

Steps To Change Car Tyre :
Since the invention of cars, the most common problem that a driver faces in his lifetime is the failure of a tyre while driving. The service industry has been in vogue to help those unfortunate victims of such problems. However, many a time you can get stuck in the middle of the road and far away from any car repair shop. In this case, you have to do this tyre change job yourself. Moreover, as an Indian car owner, you should be mentally prepared to come across such situations as our roads are filled with those naughty humps and horrendous holes. This sounds somewhat daunting but in fact, it is one of the easiest tasks to do without taking anybody’s help. If you are the one who have been the unfortunate sufferer in the past, or you are a car owner and don’t know how to overcome such a situation, then you can follow these simple steps for changing tyre:

1. Make sure you have found a safe and flat spot on the road/highway, so as to prevent your car from rolling. Switch off the engine and put the handbrake on.

2. If it’s dark, flash on emergency hazard lights so that you’re clearly visible to the oncoming traffic. Place a solid stone, concrete in front and back of the tyres for more safety.

3. Now, up your sleeves, as your man-nish side is about to be revealed, courtesy car tyre replacement. Pull out the spare wheel, jack and wheel wrench from the boot. These tyre replacement tools are often located underneath a removable section of the trunk.

4. Before you jack up the car, use the lug wrench or wheel wrench to remove the wheel nuts. Now place the jack under the front of the rear wheels, you will find a mark where the jack is intended to be placed.

5. Crank up the jack to lift the car to appropriate level off the ground.

6. Carefully remove the wheel and the flat tyre.

7. Place the fresh wheel on that place and tighten the wheel nuts. Do not tighten them hard until the jack is removed.

8. Now slowly lower the jack and tighten the wheel nuts completely. Make a double check before packing your tools.

Now as you have replaced your tyre with the new one, you are good to move. But your task of car tyre change is still incomplete. It is highly recommended to stop by the next petrol pump and check if the tyre you just installed is properly inflated or not. If you’re still uncertain about the tyre installation, move into the nearby car repair shop to clear your doubts.

Man, Fall Guys really fell off from when it started in 2019. It was AMAZING back then, so much fun, and wins felt like they actually meant something.
Now it's just bland and kinda rubbish. There is clear evidence of the usage of bots in lobbies to prop up the rapidly falling player count (as shown by 'players' attempting to hit 'waypoints' on some maps and double-backing to reach them when it made no sense to do so) to the point where I went in COLD after not playing for 2-3 years and won 2 games back-to-back. Those wins felt so boring and unrewarding because it didn't feel like I was playing against real people, and honestly, the game is too ludicrously easy.
I wish I could go back to the early days of Fall Guys, where every win was hard-fought, where it MEANT something to get that victory, where it felt gratifying and satisfying, as opposed to gaining arbitrary points to fill up a needlessly expensive battle pass and easily being able to win 10 times a day. The easier it is to win, the less satisfying it is.
This game makes me sad. Mechanically it's solid, the music is entertaining, and visually it's definitely enough to keep my focus during the game, but the soul of the game just isn't there anymore. Probably because the human players all vanished.

	Thank you for coming to my ted talk.  Today we will be talking about incest, but first let’s discuss parallel universes.  Parallel universes, otherwise known as alternate universes, are universes similar to our universe.  In some universes something different happens and we will figure out how these differences makes Incest between universes ok.
	What is incest?  In case you live under a rock or are too young to understand the concept, incest refers to the romanticized and often sexualized relationships between family members.  Kissing the girl who lives next door is not incest because she is not related to you while kissing your sister in the mouth is absolutely disgusting and incestuous.  Some cases classify incest as not all that wrong, see also Elanor Roosevelt.  As a final word about incest, incest is bad.
	How does incest relate to alternate universes?  Think of yourself as person A.  In alternate universes you have person B and person C.  If you kiss B or C you are a degenerate as person B has the same mother as you and C has the same father as you.  Notice that B and C don’t have the same parents as each other and therefore are not related so it is ok for B and C to engage in sexual actions like hand holding without any problem.  
	What about you?  Well, if B has a C, then there is a person D just for you.  This is the Diamond Incest Theory.  Person D has the same father as B and the same mother as C just as you, Person A, have the mother of B and father of C.  And just as B and C can hold hands and proceed to kiss each other on the street no problem, you and D can also engage in such acts.  The Diamond Incest Theory states that there will always be an alternate version of you and your alternate versions to the point where the only relation you have are those between the alternate universes but you don’t share the same genes, the relationship being a diamond to show the separations between point A and D.
	Today we learned a lot.  We learned about incest.  We learned about alternate universes.  And we learned about the new Diamond Incest Theory.  Thank you for coming to my ted talk.

Team games are so incredibly luck based. Every time i see a team game like: fall ball or volleyball, im visibly frustrated. Team games often ruin the game, since they can be poorly executed, like having 12 people on the other team, and 10 in the other.

I sure would recommend this game to other players. It's a fun little game with a cutsie art style, and it's basically like experiencing the dark pits of hell! (I think.) 

It's super easy to play: You run around, avoid obstacles, and grab people and throw them into the abyss! You don't have to win until the last round, you just have to not be one of the worst, and that's what makes this game fun, is that when you know you aren't doing well, you've got the power to drag someone down with you. All fun and games, and it never gets boring.

I enjoyed this game when it came out, but after a temporary hiatus I finally was in the mood to play again, only to find out I now require an Epic Games account in order to play. This normally wouldn't concern me if it were optional, but upon rejecting it the game proceeded to vomit an awful error at me, and return to the start menu, implying that it's now mandatory.

This was not the case when I bought the game.

I proceeded to uninstall immediately. I'm not making an account on Epic Games to play a game that I bought and own here, and its deceitful to implement that requirement after customers have bought the game.

Many of us wish to stay away from Epic for a host of reasons, including their business practices which result in exclusionary practices in PC gaming. Their goal is, and always has been, to market PC games as a platform-based economy, which is the exact reason many of us avoid the console industry in the first place.

If you value an open market for PC gaming, give this one a skip, bud.

The weak breeze whispers nothing
the water screams sublime.
His feet shift, teeter-totter
deep breaths, stand back, it’s time.

Toes untouch the overpass
soon he’s water-bound.
Eyes locked shut but peek to see
the view from halfway down.

A little wind, a summer sun
a river rich and regal.
A flood of fond endorphins
brings a calm that knows no equal.

You’re flying now, you see things
much more clear than from the ground.
It's all okay, or it would be
were you not now halfway down.

Thrash to break from gravity
what now could slow the drop?
All I’d give for toes to touch
the safety back at top.

But this is it, the deed is done
silence drowns the sound.
Before I leaped I should've seen
the view from halfway down.

I really should’ve thought about
the view from halfway down.
I wish I could've known about
the view from halfway down—

When I first saw I was being prompted to write a review for this game, I initially thought "yeah, of course I'll give Fall Guys a yes." But it's not "Do you like this game?" it's "Would you recommend this game to other players?" 

I would not. 

It's free, so go ahead and give it a try, but it is the same game it was 3 years ago. They made all the good cosmetics real money costs, not the crowns it used to be for actually, you know, doing the point of the game. The mini games are okay at best, most of my hours came from time killing when quarantines started. This is a very simple concept with immensely average to below average execution. They happened to release this when the iron was hot for something mindless in quarantines, and I'm sure it'll perform "fine" for the foreseeable future, but I think it'll taper fast as people realize nothing gets added, nothing has been added, and everything "good" is behind a paywall. I cannot recommend it for more than a couple hours, and that's a lame recommendation for a multiplayer title that now I guess is AAA being under the Epic umbrella, so I won't do it.
I recommend this game to people who like challenging platformers crossed with difficult mini games.

I like beans, especially in things like soup and with steaks. This game has beans, therefore I like this game. I will now write an essay regarding the history of beans.
From its origins as a wild vine in Central and South America to the thousands of varieties grown around the world today, beans have evolved to be one of the world's most important and versatile crops. The common bean (Phaseolus vulgaris) originated as a wild vine in Central and South America.
For thousands of years, beans have been a staple food which was first domesticated more than 7,000 years ago in southern Mexico and Peru. In Mexico, the Indians developed black beans, white beans, and other color patterns and colors.Beans were also found in the tombs of the kings of the ancient Egypt where they were left as the food for the departed and their souls in the afterlife. The first cultivated beans appeared 4,000 years ago in the Aegean, Iberia, and transalpine Europe and they were large-seeded broad beans.Beans were an important source of protein throughout Old and New World history, and still are today. Beans are one of the longest-cultivated plants in history.

I've been embroiled with Epic Support and Fall Guys Support for roughly 3 weeks, and have lost nearly all of my earned/purchased in-game assets due to their ill preparation for cross-platform play.

1. When the game released on Switch, I attempted to link my Steam and Switch accounts to my Epic profile to enable cross-platform play. I repeatedly got error messages here: my Steam was already linked with another Epic account despite never taking this step and not having other emails/accounts that it could be used with - Yet when I attempted to sign into Epic using my Steam log-in information, I was prompted to create a new account. It was a Catch-22 where both log ins seemed to simultaneously not exist and be in use at the same time. I emailed Epic Support.

2.  I was prompted to upgrade my "nameless" account. This didn't work, as I still got the error message that my email was in use. So I still couldn't link my accounts via logging in through either Epic or Steam. Epic Support left me on read for 7+ days, despite me emailing back and asking questions about the unsolved issue, so I started a new ticket.

3. Through experimenting, I found that I needed to create burner emails in order to make new Epic profiles for Steam and Switch. This let me sign in, unlink my accounts, put in a request to delete the burner profiles, then sign into my actual Epic account and link it all together. Everything seemed to be linked.

4. Now Fall Guys won't load on any platform. At all. I emailed both Epic and Steam support, and am told to verify my Steam files in order to fix the Error Code 200_19002. I follow these instructions and the game will now actually load on my PC.

5. Plot twist: Despite being told that by linking and signing into Steam first, this would become my "primary profile," that wasn't the case. The first time that I loaded up Fall Guys (after linking everything) showed me a completely blank profile without any of my assets: no kudos, cosmetic items, crown progression, achievements, etc. Epic Support told me to now email Fall Guys Support.

6. Fall Guys support tells me that they can move cosmetic items *only* to my new primary account and that the process can only be done once. I balk at this and ask for clarification: I do not want to move accounts, especially since there shouldn't *be* any other accounts, I simply want access to my Steam account. I ask questions to ensure that I would retain all of my assets and progression. When Fall Guys confirm that I would regain full access to my Steam profile, I give permission to make Steam my primary profile.

7. Welp, only my cosmetic items appear. Fall Guys Support now says that I can't access my progress or currency because they exist in an entirely different Epic profile. When I'm told this Epic ID, it is not one that I have ever accessed or even knew existed. Fall Guys confirms that it isn't associated with any of the emails or accounts that we had been dealing with over the past 11 days. When I question why all this is happening, I'm referred back to Epic Support and told to return once I have an answer from them.

8. I email Epic Support multiple times to get information on where this new ID came from, what log in credentials are associated with it, and how I can access it. I'm left on read for over a week. Finally I'm told that they sent out a new password link to the associated email. I hunt through my old defunct addresses and find one that I literally have not used in 10+ years, and reset the password for my Epic account that I've never before used.

9. Now the Epic website won't load for me. I can sign in, but trying to access my profile gives me an infinite loading screen. This doesn't happen on my actual Epic profile, and it doesn't seem to be an issue with my Internet or device. Support never gives me a response about this problem and instead sends and resends copy-pasted instructions on how to link my Steam account. Without Epic making any progress, Fall Guys support tries to close my ticket multiple times.


So that's where we are now, 22 days later. I've played Fall Guys extensively in the past, lost 110k kudos, lost my crown progress, lost my achievements, and am no closer to getting any of it back.

[Edit]: Solved! After Epic stopped answering my emails and Fall Guys closed my ticket twice (despite me emailing them back reminders that they told me to speak with Epic and then report back to solve the issue, and that the problem was still occurring), I found a roundabout answer. If I "signed in" to my Epic account via my Steam log in info, I was able to unlink my accounts without ever actually loading my profile page. This allowed me to link my Steam and Switch accounts with the new/old/unknown account and get my assets back. I am now apparently using the mystery Epic account, despite never being able to get it to load, but at least I have all of my kudos and achievements.  

This awful experience with Support has honestly killed any desire that I had left to play this game. It's hugely disappointing that something I enjoyed could be so thoroughly ruined by poor preparation and complete disregard for customer investment. I don't see myself supporting these companies in the future.

Back when I had purchased the game when it was first released it was a lot of fun. It catered towards the audience that wanted a free-for-all game to play with friends. It was repetitive sure, but still really enjoyable to play with friends. With this update to free-to-play I have never been so disappointed. The game is extremely buggy, almost impossible to load into the actual game without getting stuck on a black screen for 10 minutes, and overall an unfortunate downgrade of product. Crowns no longer matter, which is a huge thing in my opinion. What used to be a form of currency and reward for winning is no longer applicable. They transformed crowns into the currency "Kudos", which when you look into the new items store, is barely used at all, and the items Kudos are used for, are items that are unappealing and not nearly as exciting as the items you purchase with real money. What used to be a game that catered to the enjoyment of their audience has deteriorated into the real "Pay to Play" mentality. What a let down.

They made the game f2p on the Epic Games Store. I paid I think 30 dollars for it on steam. What they did is that they gutted the premium currency (crowns) which you could get for free and replaced them with "Showbucks" Now every somewhat decent item costs like 800 showbucks which is like 5 dollars. And they changed the shop UI and it looks like Fortnite but even worse. And the crowns you had from before were converted into Kudos, (the regular points) not showbucks. And their "compensation" was some dumb free items that i'll never use and look hideous.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I'm not someone who's a big Fall Guys player, but it feels like they went overboard with the changes. It feels like too much all at once.

This game went from an amusement park where you pay an entry fee to ride everything with a few small optional side purchases to a sleazy carnival where grifters try to take your money. The pricing isn't fair, and your enjoyment of the game is now limited entirely to just playing as-is. Thanks EPIC.

Half the game is the gameplay, and half is item/skin collecting, and anyone who doesn't want to pay the exorbitant price is cut off from half the game. Before, gameplay would reward you with currency used to purchase the cosmetics. Now, there's a divide between them, where you have to pay real money for cosmetics, and the gameplay earns you basically nothing. 

That split between both halves of what Fall Guys is, is the thing that will hurt it most. Playing more to earn the cosmetics you wanted was one of the reasons to play the game. The game now lacks a sense of achievement, something to earn, and the ability to get 99% of everything in it for free. 

I hope Mediatonic will realize that the core pillar of the game's gameplay loop is broken and could potentially negatively impact the game's retention rate. Meaning that they could lose all of the new players they gained from the shift to crossplay if they don't do something.

Epic game store got rid of the crown currency (which you got for winning/doing very well) and replaced it with in-game purchases. Essentially getting rid of half of the items unless you want to shill over a party game with baby mechanics. But they also made the game free, so idk, win-lose.

Still would recommend. Party games are pretty much all trash, but this one has some fun moments. You're shaped like a marshmallow and you have the movement of one. It's a party game, you go in for a couple of rounds for a laugh with friends, which it achieves well. You also don't have to deal with garbage RNG mechanics from games like Pummel Party and Mario Party. There's no collecting stars or tokens, last marshmallow shaped dude with a funny costume standing wins.

7/10 if you're playing with friends for like 30 minutes, 3/10 if you expect a good game

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I remember when I bought this game in 2021. A key part of that memory involves the fact that, at that time, I was actually able to, you know, play the game. (For a few hours. I think I snagged it during a sale, tried it out for a bit, and then planned on playing it more substantially later.)

Now. in 2022, I attempt to start the game up. I discover that there are now about 10 layers of Epic Games garbage retrofitted to the game; and so in addition to taking forever to launch, it never gets past the very first "Loading" screen. I literally can't even make it to the main menu. I've done all the usual troubleshooting steps, and nothing works. [b]It's just completely effing broken.[/b]

Add to that the various other controversial changes apparently done to the game in the time since the developers/publishers sold their souls to Epic Games (these changes are well-documented by others), and the only message I can reasonably say I'm getting from the people behind this game is a giant middle finger.

I'm currently attempting to get a refund, since I bought the game under a particular understanding, and the game has been completely changed in such a way that it no longer reflects the buying decision I originally made at all. (For example: when I bought it, I did so on the understanding that I would be able to, like, you know, [b]play the game[/b], or at least even get to the main menu. And while this was possible at the time I paid for the game, it's no longer possible. Not being able to play the game is one fairly significant factor that would generally tend to make me not want to spend money on a game and buy it.)

[b]If the developers/publishers are going to take away my ability to play the game I paid for, then I think it's only fair that I be allowed to take away the money that I gave them, in good faith, on the understanding that I'd be able to effing play the damn thing in the first place.[/b]

[b]UPDATE:[/b]

For anyone who runs into the same problem I did: After an inane amount of time wasted troubleshooting this stupid problem, I have concluded that the infinite loading screen is, in fact, actually just Epic Games's intuitive way of informing you that you need to link your Epic Games account to your Steam account in order for the game to load. Their game overlay system is apparently broken or fucked or whatever, and so it just doesn't bother to show up and inform you of what the hell you need to actually do. This is genius-level game design. Also, if you weren't able to figure out that "infinite loading screen means I need to link my accounts", then you are probably an idiot who will be yelled at by other, definitely much smarter, people for not being able to figure out such an obvious thing yourself.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

I still love this game and love playing it, but I still have my complaints. Personally, I really love this game, it's cute art style and good game mechanics. The major thing I hate though is, that with the Epic Games take over, they changed the crown system. You now have to acquire something called "Show-Bucks”' which you either have to earn with the season pass, or you have to buy. (Pretty sure you have to buy the season pass too, I just got it for free because I bought the game.) Over half of the cosmetics in the item shop cost Show-Bucks as well, so Kudos aren't as useful. It's also really annoying because now, the only reason for crowns now (That I know of) is to get your crown level up. They're trying to make the currency system more like Fortnite, which is really annoying because, with Fortnite, you really can't do much cosmetic-wise by not purchasing anything. Although this isn't a major problem, it's just kinda annoying because I like making the dumbest combinations, but I can't do that now because of this Show-Bucks thing. I would still recommend the game because it's fun, but if you're looking for cosmetics, you might have to dig in the couch to get that extra 5$ to be able to buy some Show-Bucks. Half the things in the shop cost like 500-100 Show-Bucks too, so that will take 5$ for 1 thing. I'm also not a fan of the newer maps, but that's probably just because I need to get used to them.

The game was great until it went F2P and they made it so you need to buy real currency for most of the Item Shop Skins and Items, as well as skins previously obtainable from using Crowns in the store.
Being able to buy the cool Item Shop skins with Crowns which you earn from winning was so much better and actually gave you a sense of reward for winning and a drive to want to play more of the game and grind it out for more wins and then crowns to spend on more Skins in the shop.
But now the game just feels like a big cash grab and a slap in the face to players who bought the game and have been left in the dust to deal with the new changes and have absolutely no say in what happens and the way the game was adapted to become F2P, so yeah honestly it's a fun free game to play with friends but I most definitely miss the old Fall Guys system.
Epic took over. Removed content and removed the crown system. The outfits are now for cash only. Horrible change.

Another game that became popular during the pandemic, not as popular as Among Us, but still fun. I had to join in on the hype when it came out so I bought it. It is an insanely fun online obstacle course competition with colorful “bean” shaped characters that you can dress up. You play with other online players who race against each other to the finish line to qualify for the next round. There can be as many as 60 players and goes down each round and there are different courses that you can play.

I am absolutely horrible at it. I think I’ve only gotten to the third match once and the other times I could barely beat the 1st match and get to the second. I didn’t play that much because while the obstacle courses were straightforward, they were HARD!! At least for me. I would fall over and over and would be disqualified. Knocking into the other players and falling over and missing a jump. I kept trying though. Even though I kept failing, I still think its a fun game. I still plan to play periodically when I am in the mood for it.

Reaching out to you about something this shouldn't be that hard.

Game ruined by Epic Games acquisition. The core gameplay loop of grinding kudos and winning crowns through matches, all to buy cool and rare cosmetics was removed. Crowns are now useless & converted to kudos, and kudos are simply useless due to not being able to purchase anything decent. What little there is to purchase with kudos is complete random garbage on a daily & weekly shop with a cooldown period, yet the shop reserves more than 50% of the item spots on microtransactions. 

Steam DLCs with costumes were removed & each costume is now an individual  microtransaction that is twice as expensive as the entire DLC pack on steam itself was.

[h1]It's hard to believe how badly this game has been ruined[/h1]

I haven't touched this game in maybe 6 months, after game went f2p i log on and suddenly my crowns are converted to kudos and all the skins for kudos are bad, and the cool ones you have to pay real money for an in-game currency to obtain. But let's talk a little more about a new direction that mediatonic took.
[b]Season Pass[/b]
In the old Fall Guys, the Season Pass got you everything, and it was great. Leveling up didn’t take too long and the amount of costumes and such you could get was very nice. However, now in order to get the ‘good’ stuff, you now have to pay for it. On top of this, getting Fame is much slower, and losing Round 1 actually nets you more Fame than actually winning, which is such a basic design flaw that I’m shocked got through. Not very good overall

[b]The Shop and Currency[/b]
Hoo boy, where do I begin. Crown are no longer an actual currency, and instead Show-Bucks are here to take their spot, which is not a good thing. You can only get 300 Show-Bucks for free and the rest have to get paid for with real money. Something even more insulting is how costumes that were bought with Crowns as a sign of skill are now paid for with Show-Bucks. Onto Kudos, the fact that you can only get 200 a day is absurd, and you don’t get any by playing game! The shop is a complete mess and needs a big fix-up.

tldr: Mediatonic are greedy, lazy douchebags. Their goal was to make the legacy players get completely fed up and stop playing, as they would be least likely to spend actual money. MT doesn't give a shit if legacy players quit, they have all new players to farm info from and use predatory tactics against.

Another s*** battleground game with terrible
controls, terrible game modes, and obvious fortnite inspired cosmetic crap.

I’ll admit, races? Fun! Some stages are abysmal (slime climb, hidden path) but the races, are what I came to do.

However...

Controls? terrible. How does super mario 64, a game, that’s over 20 years old, still have the most fluid control for a 3-D character? This s*** plays like Bubsy 3-D.

short hop, long jump, dive, your character will randomly seize out on the ground. Roll about like he’s on fire, then recover. No amount of mashing buttons help.

Your jumps randomly do not happen. Obstacles, sometimes boop you, other times send you into the atmosphere. The physics are complete random.

Team games are s***. The terrible controls
become painfully apparent. Grab? Hardly works. You grab a fallguy with a tail,
nothing. Grab an egg? No you didn’t.

Also, for the love of god, why can you get into a team game with an odd number of players. Got eliminated on a 4 v 5 soccer game. Lovely.

Grabbing and collision should be toned down or removed for certain maps. Trolling or down right idiot players get you eliminated, and just sky rockets frustration.
