Announced at E3 2019 and released at summer 2020, already making a big sensation at its release, Fall Guys: Ultimate Knockout quickly established itself as the reference of the Battle Royale, fun and peaceful. The principle of the game is quite simple, you start at 60 players, and you must finish first after 5 random events. A handful of players are eliminated at the end of each round. You will have to overcome the traps and obstacles that accumulate on your course. The events are more delirious and crazy each other; balance on a swing, striking open/closed doors, avoid the horns of a rhinoceros, jump over a turnstile that turns faster and faster, collecting eggs, catch a penguin, etc. The races are all fraught with pitfalls! Also, you can customize your bean (the characters in the game) with different skins and costumes using the "Kudos" points (the money of the game) and crowns that you earn thanks to the fruit of your hard work.

"Colorful and fun, this Battle Royale is an ocean of joy and good humor! To try it, is to adopt it. Of course, we sometimes complain; we hit each other, we catch each other, we slip, we fall, we lose... But it is always with a smile that we restart a game (the very essence of a good Battle Royale). And when you finish number one, what a satisfaction! I would compare this Fall Guys: Ultimate Knockout to a sweet; pretty, colorful, generous, you want to eat it often, and eat it even more (until diabetic, I agree), but what a treat! It is also a bit of a favorite teddy bear that doesn't leave your room, he's cute and funny, why not play with him anymore!! A kind of Proust madeleine of modern video games. I recommend this game."

Signed by Cyrille aka Angels fight devils with grace.

Its a really fun game, ideal if you are looking for a fun chaotic platform game.

It mixes the best and worst parts of a party game, the incredible anger, the joy, the weird and unexpected, its a game mostly made for fun but which lets you try to be competitive if you choose, as there are guys trying to find the quickest ways to finish the racing stages.

Winning depends on equal parts skill and luck, and the only thing to gain are silly new costumes to wow the competition. Its probably the most healthy BR style game there is.

Fall Guys is one of those games that I've always wished existed. Where you can just goof around on a level, not take things so seriously and just go through a simple yet fun set of obstacle courses. 

I remember when first purchasing it with friends the first thing we noticed was the price tag with many thinking it may be too high. After playing the game for over 20 hours I can safely say that I plan on spending many more hours on this game and I do believe it's worth the price tag. 

Playing with friends is going to be the better way to play and is a lot more enjoyable and it does have a lot of replayability but only in short bursts, I would say. 

Overall, the graphics, gameplay, and value of this game I would say are on point with very minimal bugs from my experience.

Prepare to be frustrated. There are plenty of games/boards that have moments of frustration, but there are several that are literal coin flips and/or just nearly impossible for new players. The game isn't completely unfun, but there are times when you'll wonder why you bother playing this game. I wouldn't recommend this game when there are alternatives that are a lot more fun without the hassle.

I started playing since Season 1, took a break for S2 & S3, and came back in S4 and now we're in S5. I love hopping on every day to do my daily missions, make some progress in the battlepass, and grind those crown shards. Over time, I got better at the game and even managed to get my own wins! Although I may never get the golden knight at the end of the 50th crown rank, I still keep going at it :3 I think because you never know how other players will play, it's always interesting to find someone who'll grab you at the end to take the crown. 

Now that we're in S5, there's so many rounds in the rotation that there's always variety to each run. I know that I can usually expect two race rounds and then from there I have no idea what's next! I also love seeing all the different costume combinations people do :3

I think we all know that feeling of trying to make it to the finish line in the last slot only to see someone waiting there for you to come close only to take your spot at the end. There's frustrating moments, especially in squad matches when someone leaves and your squad is doomed just by sheer numbers. Yet, I think the fun I have outweighs the negatives ^_^

Honestly this is one of those cases where I wish Steam had a "mixed" review.  I do applaud the developers for coming up with a relatively unique idea for a game and the graphics and music are well done, but that's about where the good stuff ends for me.  My main issues are:
- There are too many games that I don't find fun at all (any of the tail games, See Saw, the fruit matching one)
- Even if you advance to the final, if you're anything like me you will lose 9/10 times.  Ultimately it isn't satisfying for me to continue playing a game where ultimately I end up losing 90%+ of the time (even if you play well there is still a lot left to luck) so I ended up deciding there are better ways to spend my time.  I thought maybe the new squad mode would make it better, but most of the time I end up dragged down by my squadmates so I'm better off solo.
- Loading and queue times are longer than they should be at this point in the game's life.

Still, there is some fun to be had here.  Some of the games are actually pretty fun, and I imagine if you play it with friends it is significantly better.  But ultimately if you are a competitive person I highly recommend against this game, and even if you aren't I would watch some gameplay first before buying.

My wife showed me Fall Guys a few months ago and we didn't play it much after until now, despite not really being that good at the game she is a pro! Honestly most of the time I'm stuck on the same frustrating steps just to likely end up spectating her anyhow but I like to look at it like training, shes good about vocalizing her thoughts while playing and elaborating her movements, makes learning the tricks a little easier for me. 

Game definitely requires some quick thinking and reflex, consistent moving obstacles and plenty of players to harass you off the edge/drag you down or into a trap makes it even more fun and challenging than the course already can be!

Family friendly even down to the name system and the controls are simple enough that anyone any age could jump in and have a great time after some warm ups!

Goofy player models and bright wacky season rewards make it fun even out of game! I change my player around all the time! 

Over all I say it's a keeper, I don't know how long the fun will last but it hasn't subsided any yet! If you haven't already I say grab it and play with some friends! (or your S/O like I do! <3)

You know, sometimes people ask me why I chose to get Fall Guy plastic surgery and I can't really give them an answer. It's not because I'm afraid they'll dislike me or think I'm a freak or anything, it's that I just can't pinpoint an answer. I mean, yeah, the sexual attraction was always there, but I don't think that's really it. My dad was an alcoholic. He was never really there, he was always wasting his time and money at the bar. Before he left for the bar, he would always tell me, "You stay there and play those games and if you're not there when I get back… well boy, there'll be hell to pay". So I played video games. My favorite game was Fall Guys. I just loved that bean; the way he talked, the way he sang and dance. It was great. I… I guess I looked at Fall Guy as the father I never had. I mean, he taught me how to ride a bike, he taught me how to swim, he taught me everything. But I didn't just want to be LIKE Fall Guy, I wanted to BE him. Well, here I am, Fall Guy. This is me, this is who I was born to be.
